name: normalize-by-median.py
description: Do digital normalization (remove mostly redundant sequences)

options.description: show program's version number and exit
print citation information
show this help message and exit
k-mer size to use (default: 32)
approximate number of unique kmers in the input set (default: 0)
Override the automatic FP rate setting for the current script (default: None)
maximum amount of memory to use for data structure (default: None)
Reduce memory usage by using a smaller counter for individual kmers. (default: False)
when the median k-mer coverage level is above this number the read is not kept. (default: 20)
require that all sequences be properly paired (default: False)
treat all sequences as single-ended/unpaired (default: False)
include a file of unpaired reads to which -p/--paired does not apply. (default: None)
save the k-mer countgraph to disk after all reads are loaded. (default: None)
write progress report to report_filename (default: None)
report progress every report_frequency reads (default: 100000)
continue past file reading errors (default: False)
only output a single file with the specified filename; use a single dash "-" to specify that output should go to STDOUT (the terminal) (default: None)
load a precomputed k-mer graph from disk (default: None)
Compress output using gzip (default: False)
Compress output using bzip2 (default: False)
